channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report E-2024070117
item.description:
Report E-2024070117

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: SHELBY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCF experienced a UN1824 Sodium Hydroxide 50% DIA release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the poly drum, wood pallet, and concrete dock due to loose bung caps. The drum and impacted areas were wiped down and neutralized. The caps were reseated and secured for shipment on. The impacted pads and PPE were placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024070077
item.description:
Report E-2024070077

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: WALCOTT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped at the end of the day and was doing post-trip and saw moisture on the bottom of the trailer nothing was dripping but driver put down absorbent cloth just in case. The driver then called the emergency number at 2000ET. W crew was the dispatched and arrived at 1000ET. The discovered the the cap on the top of the tote was not secured properly and they fixed the cap. They then wiped up any residue that had come out approximately 2 cups and disposed of the material per the regulations. The clean up was completed at 1100ET.
